page.title: 11Ecology in New Galloway area
page.content: More and more of New Galloway and district is becoming a conservation area. This is a situation of which the villagers approve. There is a bird sanctuary by Loch Ken. The climate is rather warm and wet compared to Scotland as a whole. Because of the effect this has on the soils, the land is ideal for grass growing (i.e.for livestock rearing and sheep grazing) and afforestation. There are various footpaths, giving panoramic views, at the golf course, the Brough, McQueen's path and, of course, the recently formed Southern Upland Way which runs through the hills surrounding New Galloway. There is little pollution. Cars are mainly used to get out of New Galloway to the town.There is the fear of acid rain having a permanent effect.30% in our survey are,actively,trying to curb it.
